results.title: Maydina the shadow 1890's
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Two of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. This episode examines the life of Maydina and her half-caste daughter on a church mission run by a self-appointed guardian at the turn of the century. Follows her struggle to return to a tribal existence and her efforts to prevent her daughter being taken away from her by the mission guardian.

results.title: Women in the Eighties
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: United we sit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women in the Eighties”.
Helen Monaghan, shop steward in a Scottish jeans factory, tells how 240 women organised a seven month sit-in to fight for their jobs, and won.

results.title: Full circle
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This is a stirring documentary that awakens memories of ancestral roots that connect us to each other and to all living things. It is a journey that looks at some of the manifestations of the modern women’s spirituality movement in the western world. Through contmporary spirituality, whether from Wicca, pagan or indigenous peoples we see people communing with each other or alone. Rituals become gateways that lead to an inner place where twentieth century notions of domination over the earth are replaced with a sense of awe.

results.title: The Burning times
results.creator_credit: Donna Read, Signe Johansson, Margaret Pettigrew, Mary Armstrong and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This beautifully crafted documentary is an in-depth look at the witch persecutions that swept through Europe just a few hundred years ago. False accusations and trials led to extensive torture and burnings at the stake, and ultimatley to the destruction of a way of life that had endured for thousands of years. Of those killed, 85% were women and widespread violence against women, still prevalent today, can be traced back to those times. It investigates the role of the Catholic Church in the crimes and explores the process whereby the old pagan communities, founded on spirituality and cooperation, were transformed into the misogynist capitalist societies of our own century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donna Read, Signe Johansson, Margaret Pettigrew, Mary Armstrong and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Goddess remembered
results.creator_credit: Donna Read, Magaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This stunning and poetic documentary is a salute to 35,000 years of pre-history, to the solid values of ancestors only recently remembered, and to our ancient goddess-worshipping religions. Archaeologists and anthropologists are beginning to discover evidence of a widespread early civilisation based primarily on human co-operation. This epsiode reveals these forgotten cultures - taking us from ancient caves in France to the sun-drenched palaces at Delphi and Crete. There is also a discussion among well-known scholars such as Merlin Stone and Jean Bolen, who propose a return to a belief in an interconnected life system, with respect for the earth and the female.

group_works.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
group_works.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)

results.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
results.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women’s Decade”.
Four heads of permanent missions to the United Nations discuss the issues of women’s rights. 1976-1985 has been designated as the United Nations decade for women, and a female journalist interviews these four male ambassadors about aims for this decade.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)
